questions.question: What is the primary goal of regression testing?
options: To ensure that new code changes have not adversely affected the existing functionalities.
To verify the performance of the application.
To test the usability of the application.
To validate the new features added to the application.
questions.answer: To ensure that new code changes have not adversely affected the existing functionalities.

questions.question: Which type of regression testing focuses on testing only the modified areas of the application?
options: Selective Regression Testing
Full Regression Testing
Partial Regression Testing
Smoke Testing
questions.answer: Selective Regression Testing

questions.question: When is regression testing typically performed during the software development lifecycle?
options: After each code change or bug fix.
Only after the completion of the entire development process.
During the initial testing phase only.
Only before the final release of the product.
questions.answer: After each code change or bug fix.

questions.question: What is the main challenge associated with regression testing?
options: Ensuring that all test cases are executed within a limited timeframe.
Identifying new features to be tested.
Designing new test cases.
Creating detailed test documentation.
questions.answer: Ensuring that all test cases are executed within a limited timeframe.

questions.question: What role does automation play in regression testing?
options: Automation helps in executing repetitive regression tests quickly and accurately.
Automation is used to design new test cases.
Automation helps in performing exploratory testing.
Automation replaces the need for manual testing entirely.
questions.answer: Automation helps in executing repetitive regression tests quickly and accurately.

questions.question: Which approach is most effective for maintaining regression test suites over time?
options: Regularly updating and optimizing the test suite.
Relying on test cases without modification.
Creating new test cases for every release.
Ignoring test results from previous cycles.
questions.answer: Regularly updating and optimizing the test suite.

questions.question: What is 'Test Impact Analysis' in the context of regression testing?
options: Determining which parts of the codebase are affected by recent changes to prioritize test execution.
Analyzing the performance impact of tests on the application.
Assessing the impact of test automation on development speed.
Evaluating the impact of test failures on the project timeline.
questions.answer: Determining which parts of the codebase are affected by recent changes to prioritize test execution.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Smoke Testing' in relation to regression testing?
options: To ensure that the basic functionalities of the application are working before detailed regression tests are run.
To test the application’s performance under load.
To verify new features in isolation.
To perform detailed functional testing of the application.
questions.answer: To ensure that the basic functionalities of the application are working before detailed regression tests are run.

questions.question: How does 'Regression Test Optimization' benefit the testing process?
options: By reducing the number of test cases that need to be executed while maintaining test coverage.
By increasing the number of test cases to ensure complete coverage.
By automating all test cases for faster execution.
By delaying the testing phase until the end of the development cycle.
questions.answer: By reducing the number of test cases that need to be executed while maintaining test coverage.

questions.question: What is the main objective of 'Full Regression Testing'?
options: To test the entire application to ensure that all functionalities are working as expected after changes.
To test only the new features added in the recent release.
To perform a high-level overview of the application’s functionality.
To test the performance and scalability of the application.
questions.answer: To test the entire application to ensure that all functionalities are working as expected after changes.

questions.question: Which technique is used to minimize the risk of regression issues?
options: Implementing automated regression tests and continuous integration.
Only performing manual regression tests.
Running regression tests after every few weeks.
Ignoring failed test cases in regression testing.
questions.answer: Implementing automated regression tests and continuous integration.

questions.question: What is 'Test Case Prioritization' in regression testing?
options: The process of executing test cases based on their importance and likelihood of finding defects.
The method of creating new test cases for every release.
The practice of running all test cases in a predefined order.
The technique of rewriting test cases for better accuracy.
questions.answer: The process of executing test cases based on their importance and likelihood of finding defects.

questions.question: How can 'Test Automation Frameworks' support regression testing?
options: By providing a structured environment for automating test cases and managing test execution.
By replacing the need for manual regression testing entirely.
By generating test data for each test case.
By offering detailed documentation for test cases.
questions.answer: By providing a structured environment for automating test cases and managing test execution.

questions.question: What is 'Regression Test Selection'?
options: The process of selecting specific test cases to run based on recent changes to the application.
The technique of creating new test cases for each release.
The approach of running all test cases without selection.
The practice of excluding tests that have failed in the past.
questions.answer: The process of selecting specific test cases to run based on recent changes to the application.

questions.question: What is 'Test Data Management' in the context of regression testing?
options: The process of creating, maintaining, and managing test data for executing test cases.
The technique of analyzing test results.
The approach of optimizing test case execution.
The practice of writing new test cases.
questions.answer: The process of creating, maintaining, and managing test data for executing test cases.

questions.question: What is the role of 'Continuous Integration' in regression testing?
options: To integrate code changes continuously and run automated regression tests to detect issues early.
To manually test the application at the end of each development cycle.
To generate detailed test reports for every regression test.
To document each code change made during the development process.
questions.answer: To integrate code changes continuously and run automated regression tests to detect issues early.

questions.question: How does 'Risk-Based Regression Testing' differ from other approaches?
options: It prioritizes test cases based on the risk of failure and impact on the application.
It focuses on executing all available test cases regardless of their relevance.
It only runs tests that have failed in previous cycles.
It minimizes the number of test cases by focusing only on new features.
questions.answer: It prioritizes test cases based on the risk of failure and impact on the application.

questions.question: What is 'Regression Testing Metrics' used for?
options: To measure the effectiveness and coverage of regression testing.
To identify new features to be tested.
To document test case execution steps.
To evaluate the performance of the test automation tools.
questions.answer: To measure the effectiveness and coverage of regression testing.

questions.question: What does 'Test Coverage Analysis' involve in regression testing?
options: Evaluating how much of the codebase is covered by the regression tests.
Analyzing the performance impact of regression tests.
Assessing the cost of running regression tests.
Determining the time required to execute all regression tests.
questions.answer: Evaluating how much of the codebase is covered by the regression tests.

questions.question: How can 'Test Environment Management' impact regression testing?
options: By ensuring that the test environment mirrors the production environment to catch environment-specific issues.
By automating all aspects of the testing process.
By creating new test cases based on the test environment.
By reducing the number of test environments needed.
questions.answer: By ensuring that the test environment mirrors the production environment to catch environment-specific issues.

questions.question: What is 'Test Case Maintenance' in regression testing?
options: Updating and refining test cases to ensure they remain relevant and effective over time.
Creating new test cases for each release.
Removing old test cases from the test suite.
Documenting the execution of test cases.
questions.answer: Updating and refining test cases to ensure they remain relevant and effective over time.

questions.question: What is 'Defect Leakage' in the context of regression testing?
options: The occurrence of defects that were not detected during regression testing but are found in production.
The process of identifying and fixing defects during testing.
The practice of leaking sensitive data during testing.
The technique of integrating defects into the test cases.
questions.answer: The occurrence of defects that were not detected during regression testing but are found in production.

questions.question: Which tool or technique is commonly used to manage and execute automated regression tests?
options: Test Automation Frameworks
Manual Testing Scripts
Performance Testing Tools
Bug Tracking Software
questions.answer: Test Automation Frameworks

questions.question: What is 'Test Suite Management' in regression testing?
options: The process of organizing and managing a collection of test cases to ensure efficient execution and maintenance.
The practice of creating new test cases for each release.
The technique of documenting test results.
The approach of running all test cases in a predefined order.
questions.answer: The process of organizing and managing a collection of test cases to ensure efficient execution and maintenance.

questions.question: What does 'Test Result Analysis' involve in regression testing?
options: Evaluating the results of regression tests to identify issues and improvements.
Creating new test cases based on test results.
Documenting the steps of each test case.
Assessing the cost of running regression tests.
questions.answer: Evaluating the results of regression tests to identify issues and improvements.

questions.question: What is 'Test Automation Strategy' in relation to regression testing?
options: A plan for implementing automation in regression testing to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
A set of guidelines for manual testing.
A method for generating test data.
A technique for designing new test cases.
questions.answer: A plan for implementing automation in regression testing to improve efficiency and effectiveness.

questions.question: How does 'Version Control' impact regression testing?
options: By managing changes to test scripts and ensuring that the correct versions are used during testing.
By documenting the results of each test case.
By creating new versions of test cases for each release.
By automating the execution of test cases.
questions.answer: By managing changes to test scripts and ensuring that the correct versions are used during testing.

questions.question: What is 'Code Coverage' in regression testing?
options: A measure of how much of the codebase is executed by the test cases.
A technique for testing the performance of the application.
A method for identifying new features in the application.
A way to document the execution of test cases.
questions.answer: A measure of how much of the codebase is executed by the test cases.

questions.question: What is 'Regression Test Planning'?
options: The process of creating a strategy and schedule for executing regression tests to ensure effective coverage and efficiency.
The technique of designing new test cases.
The approach of documenting each test case.
The method of evaluating test results.
questions.answer: The process of creating a strategy and schedule for executing regression tests to ensure effective coverage and efficiency.

questions.question: What is 'Test Execution Reporting' in regression testing?
options: The process of documenting and communicating the results of regression test executions.
The technique of creating new test cases based on execution results.
The method of generating test data.
The practice of automating test execution.
questions.answer: The process of documenting and communicating the results of regression test executions.
